attributes.action: cap the rate of interest on credit/store cards and personal loans to 17.5%
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: I would recomend the capping of all loans at a maximum of 17.5%, however i would also state that it should be harder for individuals to commit to borrowing that in the long term if  they may not be able to resonably afford the re-payments. By this i would say that if an individual applies for a loan in any part of the fiscal year, then they should automatically be excluded from making a further loan application untill they have proven their ability to pay their existing loan. Also by capping the loans at 17.5% would prevent companies making unbelievable profit at the expence of those that may not be able to afford unrealisticaly high interest rates of up to 70% Pa - or p.c.m, and thus ensuring that the individual is entraped to a lender for many years, with the hardship that these extortionate rates bring to both individuals and famillies concerned
